SEARCH

Package org.loudouncodes.combinatorics

package org.loudouncodes.combinatorics
Combinatorial generators with a fluent, classroom-friendly API.

What’s here

  • Combinations (with/without repetition)
  • Permutations (k-permutations of n)
  • Derangements (no fixed points)
  • Cartesian product (mixed radix)
  • Power set (size-then-lex order)
  • IndexingAdapter (map int indices to real objects)

Fluent map


 // Combinations (no repetition)
 for (int[] c : Combinations.of(5).choose(2)) {
   // [0,1], [0,2], ...
 }

 // Combinations with repetition (multiset combinations)
 for (int[] c : Combinations.of(3).withRepetition().choose(2)) {
   // [0,0], [0,1], ...
 }

 // Permutations: ordered tuples without repetition
 for (int[] p : Permutations.of(5).take(3)) {
   // [0,1,2], [0,1,3], ...
 }

 // Derangements: full-length permutations with no fixed points
 for (int[] d : Derangements.of(4).all()) {
   // [1,0,3,2], [1,2,3,0], ...
 }

 // Cartesian product (rightmost coordinate varies fastest)
 for (int[] t : CartesianProduct.of(2, 3)) {
   // [0,0], [0,1], [0,2], [1,0], ...
 }

 // Power set (size-then-lex)
 for (int[] s : PowerSet.of(3)) {
   // [], [0], [1], [2], [0,1], [0,2], [1,2], [0,1,2]
 }

Counting helpers

  • Combinations.of(n).choose(k).size() → C(n,k)
  • Combinations.of(n).withRepetition().choose(k).size() → C(n+k-1,k)
  • Permutations.of(n).take(k).size() → P(n,k) = n!/(n-k)!
  • Derangements.of(n).all().size() → !n (subfactorial)
  • CartesianProduct.of(dims...).size() → ∏ dims[i]; sizeExact() available
  • PowerSet.of(n).count() → 2^n (BigInteger); size() alias provided

Design guarantees

  • Lazy iteration; no pre-materialization.
  • Deterministic order (documented per class).
  • Defensive copies on outputs.
  • Strict iterator contract; exhaustion throws NoSuchElementException.
  • Fail-fast validation with IllegalArgumentException.
Since:
0.2.0
  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    BinaryGray
    Binary Gray codes of length n.
    BinaryGray.AsBigMasks
    Iterable over BigInteger Gray bitmasks, any n >= 0.
    BinaryGray.AsBits
    Iterable over bit vectors (arrays of 0/1), minimal-change order, any n >= 0.
    BinaryGray.AsInts
    Iterable over int Gray codes, n <= 31.
    BinaryGray.AsLongMasks
    Iterable over long Gray bitmasks, n <= 62.
    BinaryGray.AsSubsets
    Iterable over subsets as sorted index arrays, minimal-change order, any n >= 0.
    BinaryGray.AsToggles
    Iterable over minimal-change toggle events (length 2^n - 1).
    BinaryGray.Builder
    Builder bound to n bits, offering multiple views of the same Gray sequence.
    BinaryGray.Toggle
    Minimal-change event: bit BinaryGray.Toggle.index flipped to BinaryGray.Toggle.value.
    CartesianProduct
    Fluent API for generating tuples from a mixed-radix Cartesian product.
    CartesianProduct.Product
    Iterable view of the Cartesian product for fixed dimensions.
    Combinations
    Utilities for enumerating k-subsets (combinations) of the ground set {0,1,...,n-1}.
    Combinations.KChoose
    Sized iterable over k-combinations (with or without repetition).
    Combinations.Spec
    Immutable, fluent specification for building combination iterables.
    Derangements
    Derangements — full-length permutations p of {0,1,...,n-1} with no fixed points (p[i] != i for all i).
    Derangements.All
    Iterable wrapper for all derangements of a given size.
    Derangements.Builder
    Fluent builder for derangement enumeration and counts.
    IndexingAdapter<E>
    Bridges from indices to elements.
    Permutations
    Fluent API for generating k-permutations (ordered selections without repetition) from the domain {0,1,...,n-1}.
    Permutations.Builder
    Builder capturing the domain size n.
    Permutations.KTake
    Iterable view of all k-permutations from {0..n-1}.
    PowerSet
    PowerSet — all subsets of {0,1,...,n-1}.
